activities.loc: Branch I, Courthouse Annex, Second Floor

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Benjamin Merrick Rabun

records.addlTxt: Judge response - will be heard at STC

3:31 PM Defendant Benjamin Merrick Rabun appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jon G Spansail in court for Benjamin Merrick Rabun.  Prosecuting attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Spansail heard on status - applied to Mental Health Court, awaiting evaluation.
ADA heard - assessment scheduled at end of month.
Court schedules w/parties.
3:33 pm
Status conference scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 11:30 am.

3:55 PM Prosecuting attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Benjamin Merrick Rabun appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jon G Spansail appeared by video for Benjamin Merrick Rabun. 
Copy of info filed 8-10-22.
Atty Spansail - received, waives reading, enters n/g pleas.
Court notes n/g pleas and schedules w/parties.
3:57 pm
Status conference scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Benjamin Merrick Rabun appeared by Zoom video, in custody.  Attorney Jon G Spansail in court for Benjamin Merrick Rabun.  Attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for State of Wisconsin. 
3:28 p.m.
Atty Spansail unsure if Deft wishes him to withdraw.
Deft does not want Atty Spansail to withdraw.
Deft wishes to have prelim hrg and to be in person.
Court recess for Deft to be brought over from MCJ.
Recess 3:31 p.m. Recess concluded 3:56 p.m.
Defendant Benjamin Merrick Rabun in court, in custody.  Attorney Jon G Spansail in court for Benjamin Merrick Rabun.  Attorney DeShea Morrow in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Prelim Questionnaire/Waiver filed
Court questions Deft - Deft does not completely understand.
DA is heard - not comfortable proceeding.
Atty Spansail heard.
Court will allow more time if needed.
Atty Spansail unsure if add'l time will be beneficial.
Deft wishes to waive prelim.
Atty Spansail believes Deft understands waiver.
DA satisfied w/waiver.
Court finds Deft freely waives prelim.
Deft bound over for trial.
Court schedules Arraignment. 
4:06 p.m.
Arraignment scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

8:45 AM Prosecuting attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Benjamin Merrick Rabun appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jon G Spansail in court for Benjamin Merrick Rabun. 
Court calls case. 
Copy of complaint. 
Charges and max penalties. 
Requests prelim within time limits.

8:46 AM

records.addlTxt:
Prosecuting attorney DeShea Morrow in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Benjamin Merrick Rabun appeared by video, in custody with Attorney Brad Hansen.
1:35 p.m.
Copy of Complaint
Atty Hansen appearing for bond purposes only
DA speaks on bond
Atty Hansen addresses bond
Court sets $2500 cash bail w/conditions:
Sign waiver of extradition
No possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances w/o a valid RX
No possession of any weapons.
Deft qualifies for PD - atty will be assigned.
1:41 p.m.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
